Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2013 12:02AM KDP wrote: Hi - I just wanted to share my story in case it helps anyone with the waiting game.  I felt a lump in my right breast about 3 weeks ago.  I saw my doctor within a week and she ordered a mammogram and ultrasound.  The lump I went it for was a fluid filled cyst but they saw microcalcifications in one breast and a suspicious lump in the other.  They scheduled me for two biopsies.  I spent the next week and a half freaking out.....worrying both about the procedures and the possible results.  I had a friend who recommended xanax to treat the anxiety the day of.  I talked to my dr. and got a prescription....it helped.  I spoke to the radiologist who read my films and she calmly and compassionately went over each procedure and told me exactly what to expect.  She told me that all I should feel is a prick and a little burn while the numbing medication was being injected.  She reassured me that they would make sure that I did not have pain, and should i feel anything, they would numb me up some more.  But then I also got on the internet and searched and found plenty of women who did not have this experience.  Fortunately, my experience was as the radiologist had described.  I have had dental work that has been much more painful.  The worst part of the procedure where you lay on your stomach was the neck strain I felt by having to keep my head turned. (That was pretty uncomfortable).  But the part I was worred about....needles....was really nothing.  The team who performed my biospies was compassionate, caring and comforting.  I got my results back in two days and both biopsies were benign.  I cannot explain what an incredible gift that feels like.....I am very grateful and I hope everyone that reads this who is going through the same thing, has the same experience I had....and most importantly...the same end result.  By the way.....no real after pain and only some bruising on one side.  I feel very lucky.
